metadata.Title: CVE-2020-24606 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Squid before 4.13 and 5.x before 5.0.4 allows a trusted peer to performDenial of Service by consuming all available CPU cycles during handling ofa crafted Cache Digest response message. This only occurs when cache_peeris used with the cache digests feature. The problem exists becausepeerDigestHandleReply() livelocking in peer_digest.cc mishandles EOF.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-24606` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

squid - 3.5.27-1ubuntu1.9
squid-cgi - 3.5.27-1ubuntu1.9
squid-common - 3.5.27-1ubuntu1.9
squid-purge - 3.5.27-1ubuntu1.9
squid3 - 3.5.27-1ubuntu1.9
squidclient - 3.5.27-1ubuntu1.9
No subscription required

criterions.comment: squid3 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.5.27-1ubuntu1.9').
